title.rendered: Telephone Identity Theft (Spoofing) and How to Avoid It

content.rendered:
FCC Consumer Video: Don’t Wait, Hang Up! To watch this video with subtitles, press “Play”, click the settings icon, then click “Subtitles/CC” and choose one of the available languages.

What Is Spoofing?

Phishing occurs when a caller deliberately falsifies the information transmitted to the caller ID display to hide their identity. Scammers often use neighbor spoofing, so it appears that an incoming call is coming from a local number, or from a company or government agency that you already know and trust. If you reply, they use scam scripts to try to steal your money or valuable personal information, which can be used in fraudulent activities.

Watch the video and click on the tabs to learn more about phishing and how to avoid getting scammed.

If you think you have been the victim of a phishing scam, you can file a complaint with the Federal Communications Commission (FCC).
